required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulpotomy With Various MTA Materials and Ferric Sulphate
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiographic Comparison of RetroMTA, OrthoMTA And Ferric Sulfate for Pulpotomy in Primary Molars

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study was to determine clinical and radiographic efficacy of the newly developed OrthoMTA and RetroMTA , compared frequently used ferric sulfate for pulpotomy in primary second molars.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 96 second primary second molars from 32 children ,who met inclusion criteria and were 5-9 years old were selected for the study. Teeth were randomly divided into three groups according to the planned treatment: O-MTA (n=32 teeth), R-MTA (n=32 teeth) and FS (n=32 teeth). Clinical and radiographical follow-up examinations were conducted at 3, 6 and 9 months postoperatively. The data were evaluated with Chi-square test, Cochran Q test, Post-Huc Dunn test and Kaplan-Meier analysis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change of clinical success from Baseline at 18 months

arm_group.description: Group FS. Teeth in this goup will pulpotomized with ferris-sulphate.
Group O-MTA.Teeth in this goup will pulpotomized with Ortho-mta.
Group R-MTA. Teeth in this goup will pulpotomized with Retro-mta.

intervention.description: Teeth were pulpotomized with ferric sulphate in this group.
Teeth were pulpotomized with Ortho-MTA in this group.
Teeth were pulpotomized with Retro-MTA in this group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients have at least three deep carious primary second molars
- Teeth with no spontaneous pain
- Patient who are willing to participate
- Cooperative children
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are not willing to participate
- History of systemic disease
- Pathological mobility
- Presence of internal or external root resorption
- Presence of apical radiolucency

reference.citation: Awawdeh L, Al-Qudah A, Hamouri H, Chakra RJ. Outcomes of Vital Pulp Therapy Using Mineral Trioxide Aggregate or Biodentine: A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial. J Endod. 2018 Nov;44(11):1603-1609. doi: 10.1016/j.joen.2018.08.004. Epub 2018 Oct 3.
